back_cards.example_en: The number of students in the class increased.
She wrote her phone number on the napkin.
He finished the race in first number.
A number of birds gathered on the tree.
The equation required a large number to solve.
She loves to write stories in her journal.
He wrote the meeting notes on his laptop.
They write emails to their clients daily.

back_cards.definition_en: To author a book or article.
back_cards.example_en: The professor wrote a book about history.
The kids write their names on the board.

back_cards.definition_en: To carry or take something to a place.
back_cards.example_en: Please bring your homework to class tomorrow.
The new policy will bring changes to the workplace.
She brought a new idea to the team meeting.
He brought fresh apples from the market.
The festival brings tourists to the town.
She left the house without her keys.
He completed the task without any help.
The recipe works without extra sugar.
They camped without the city limits.
The kids played without supervision.
She saved money for a new bike.
The company has a lot of money to invest.
He earned money by mowing lawns.
They raised money for the charity.
The market only accepts cash money.
She has a lot of books on her shelf.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of items or people.
back_cards.example_en: The lot of tourists arrived at the museum.
They bought a lot to build a house.
This lot of apples is fresh from the farm.
He got a lot of praise for his work.
She enjoys hiking most in the fall.
Most students passed the exam easily.
He ate most of the pizza by himself.
This is the most beautiful sunset I've seen.
Most trees in the park are oak.
She read a book about space travel.
The accountant updated the company’s book.
He bought a book of stamps at the post office.
The library has a rare book on display.
They made a book for the concert next week.
The solar system includes eight planets.
She developed a system for organizing files.
The subway system runs smoothly every day.
A virus can weaken the immune system.
The company upgraded its computer system.

back_cards.definition_en: The ruling authority of a country.
back_cards.example_en: The government passed a new law today.
Local government handles road repairs.
Good government ensures public safety.
The government met to discuss trade.
She works for the state government.
The next train arrives in five minutes.
She lives in the next house on the street.
The next chapter is about dinosaurs.
They planned the next meeting for Monday.
The next speaker is a famous author.
The city is famous for its tall skyscrapers.
She moved to the city for work.
The city council approved a new park.
Tourists love the city’s nightlife.
The city has a historic downtown.
She works for a software company.
The company of friends enjoyed the picnic.
He had company over for the holidays.
The company performed a new ballet.
The company marched in the parade.
She told a story about her childhood.
The newspaper published a story about the flood.
He wrote a story about dragons.
Grandma shared a story by the fire.
The movie has a thrilling story.
I have two meetings today.
Today, people rely on smartphones.
The weather today is sunny and warm.
Today’s youth are tech-savvy.
She decided to start exercising today.
He got a job at the factory.
Fixing the leak was a tough job.
It’s her job to feed the pets.
She applied for a teaching job.
The team finished the job early.
She moved the chair to the corner.

back_cards.definition_en: To relocate to a new home.
back_cards.example_en: They moved to a new city last month.
The company moved to expand its market.
The project is moving forward quickly.
The speech moved the audience to tears.
You must wear a helmet while biking.
We must finish the report by tomorrow.
She must be tired after the long hike.
They must act now to save the forest.
You must try the cake; it’s delicious.
The movie was so bad we left early.
The weather turned bad this afternoon.
Eating too much sugar is bad for you.
Stealing is a bad thing to do.
He had a bad cold last week.

back_cards.definition_en: A person you know and like.
back_cards.example_en: She met her friend for coffee.
He’s been my friend since childhood.
The library is a friend to the community.
She shared her secret with a friend.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a social group.
back_cards.example_en: All her friends came to the party.
It rained during the soccer game.

back_cards.definition_en: At some point in a time frame.
back_cards.example_en: She called during the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: In the course of an event.
back_cards.example_en: He fell asleep during the movie.
They laughed during the comedy show.
The shop is open during the holidays.
The concert will begin at 7 PM.
She began writing her novel last year.
They began the meeting with introductions.
The flowers begin to bloom in spring.
He began his journey with confidence.
Their love grew stronger over the years.
She has a love for painting landscapes.
The movie was about young love.
His love of chocolate is well-known.
She showed love to her stray cat.
Each student received a certificate.
She checked each box on the list.
Each team member contributed ideas.
He greeted each guest at the door.
Each flower in the garden bloomed.
She held the baby in her arms.
The glue will hold the pieces together.
The jar holds a liter of water.
He held his ground during the debate.
They hold a festival every summer.
Each snowflake has a different shape.
She chose a different dress for the party.
The menu offers different types of pizza.
His approach to the problem was different.
They come from different cultures.
She loves American football games.
The diner serves American comfort food.
American voters choose their president.
American wildlife includes bald eagles.
The movie has an American vibe.
The little bird nested in the tree.
She ate a little piece of cake.
The little boy ran to his mom.
It’s just a little scratch on the car.
They stayed for a little while.
She arrived before the meeting started.
He stood before the audience to speak.
They ate a snack before the movie.
Her name comes before mine on the list.
The case was presented before the judge.
Have you ever visited the mountains?
This is the best meal I’ve ever had.
Why did you ever choose that color?
How could she ever forget her lines?
The stars are ever shining at night.
